testsuite.name: LocationTest
testsuite.system-out: Location test: check that two Locaiton objects containing same coordinates compare as equal Testing for Locations model.Location@71f1d9a2(x=1,y=1) and model.Location@71f1d9a2(x=1,y=1): expected equality = true , returned equality = true) Testing for Locations model.Location@71f1d9a2(x=1,y=1) and model.Location@2b0d086b(x=1,y=1): expected equality = true , returned equality = true) Testing for Locations model.Location@1dfbc206(x=-1,y=-1) and model.Location@2b0d086b(x=1,y=1): expected equality = false , returned equality = false) Testing for Locations model.Location@71f1d9a2(x=1,y=1) and model.Location@1dfbc206(x=-1,y=-1): expected equality = false , returned equality = false) Testing for Locations model.Location@71f1d9a2(x=1,y=1) and null: expected equality = false , returned equality = false) Location test: check that the values given to Location(x,y) constructor are returned correctly by getX() and getY() Testing for Location(2147483647,-2147483648): getX() = 2147483647, getY() = -2147483648) Testing for Location(-2147483648,2147483647): getX() = -2147483648, getY() = 2147483647) Testing for Location(0,0): getX() = 0, getY() = 0) Testing for Location(11,9): getX() = 11, getY() = 9) Location test: check that Location object constructed from another location object has the same coordinates Testing for Location model.Location@15942d03(x=1,y=2), returned Location = model.Location@563c3645(x=1,y=2)) Location test: check that the values given to Location(x,y) constructor are returned correctly by getX() and getY() Testing for Location(2147483647,-2147483648): getX() = 2147483647, getY() = -2147483648) Testing for Location(-2147483648,2147483647): getX() = -2147483648, getY() = 2147483647) Testing for Location(0,0): getX() = 0, getY() = 0) Testing for Location(11,9): getX() = 11, getY() = 9)
